trans-unit.target: TEXT_GAIUSC612_01012_SEQ_00<tab>Simmie would entrust you with a delivery.

TEXT_GAIUSC612_01012_SEQ_01<tab>With your aid, Simmie has completed her report on the ghostly horseman sighted in the Shroud─now identified as the primal Odin. Return to the Waking Sands and deliver a copy of the report to Urianger.

TEXT_GAIUSC612_01012_SEQ_02<tab>After perusing the report, Urianger shares with you his misgivings about the historical accuracy of the scriptures. Casting light upon the events of ages past is a tall task, indeed.
TEXT_GAIUSC612_01012_TODO_00<tab>Deliver the Odin report to Urianger.
TEXT_GAIUSC612_01012_SIMMIE_000_000<tab>Your assistance in the investigation has proven invaluable, adventurer. You have our thanks.

TEXT_GAIUSC612_01012_SIMMIE_000_001<tab>With your aid, I have finally managed to complete my report─a thorough survey of all eyewitness reports, along with the most credible theories regarding the Dark Divinity's presence in the Shroud.
TEXT_GAIUSC612_01012_SIMMIE_000_002<tab>I intend to deliver copies of the report to Brother O<var 1F /var>App<var 1F /var>Pesi and Bowlord Lewin myself.
TEXT_GAIUSC612_01012_SIMMIE_000_003<tab>The Scions, too, will no doubt be eager to learn of our findings. I would be most appreciative if you could deliver a copy to Urianger in my stead.

TEXT_GAIUSC612_01012_SIMMIE_000_004<tab>My duties demand that I remain composed, but in all truth, I fear for the fate of our people. Should the time come that the Dark Divinity draws his blade against Gridania, promise me that we can count on your aid.
TEXT_GAIUSC612_01012_URIANGER_000_010<tab><var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>, I am most heartened by thy safe return. Wert thou able to cast light on the shadows that haunt the Shroud?
TEXT_GAIUSC612_01012_URIANGER_000_020<tab>...So it is true. Having awakened from nigh-eternal slumber, the Dark Divinity now rides free in the Shroud.

TEXT_GAIUSC612_01012_URIANGER_000_021<tab>Whilst you were afield, I immersed myself in the scriptures. The more I scoured the words, the more I did realize that the writings draw heavily upon Allagan historical chronicles.
TEXT_GAIUSC612_01012_URIANGER_000_022<tab>History is quite a fascinating beast, is it not? One nation's glory is another's suffering─one nation's great hero, another's most abhorrent villain.
TEXT_GAIUSC612_01012_URIANGER_000_023<tab>I mean not to speak in platitudes, only to say that there is never but a single side to any story─even a story that is presented as historical fact.

TEXT_GAIUSC612_01012_URIANGER_000_024<tab>To what end did the great hero of Allag seal Odin in a gaol of crystal? What impels the Dark Divinity to ride once again? Cast thine light on the shadows of history, friend, that we might be delivered from the darkness.
